column4: can anyone please help me, I kinda screwed my PC up installing ubuntu'
I am taking an OS class in school, so I downloaded ubuntu, installed it on a spare partition, and everything worked fine. the only problem, is that now my windows 7 is dead. Says Hal.dll is corrupte
corrupted*
you might also ask in #Linux and #Windows
Nah, it's not. So you installed Ubuntu and it boots?
unfortunately I don't use Windows. (At all) =( So I don't know what to suggest about a broken .dll (which is a windows file)
therein lies the issue - I don't know what I'm talking about concerning Windows.
it most likely did not.
give me a moment buddy. (Busy)
fail - Linux plays many of the games available on Windows. Including DirectX games.
because you lack the skill to optimize a Linux machine to run said games. I game happily in Linux.
I don't play Bad Company, but give me a disc and some time and I'll get 'er running.
How so?
understandable - now, if you need help I am more than willing to assist you. I do feel bad that your first  Linux experience is turning out to be a bad one.

I don't know what to suggest concerning your .dll. However, if you do have to reinstall across the whole machine then make sure you install Windows and then Linux. Windows likes to take over the whole MBR...
really, #Windows is the best place to ask concerning your .dll. We can't offer support for that here.
Wubi installs are... *cries*
ext4 is the file system you're thinking of. Did you do a manual partition scheme or a guided scheme?
Well, possibly

concerning installing windows/ubuntu. Unless you know what you're doing I'd recommend just doing a guided install. I know what I'm doing and I usually just do a guided install anyway when I do dual installations, etc.
you're using gcc?
